indications: Damage control surgery with ongoing physiologic derangement
Combined vascular and orthopedic injury requiring staged repair
Transfer to specialized vascular center required
Prolonged ischemia with need for fasciotomy before reconstruction
Mass casualty scenarios with resource constraints

relative: Stable patient suitable for immediate definitive repair
Vessel too small to accommodate shunt
absolute: Ability to perform definitive repair without compromising patient stability

Javid_shunt.description: Rigid plastic T-shaped shunt originally for carotid surgery
Javid_shunt.advantage: Designed for vascular use, easy insertion

Argyle_shunt.advantage: Flexible, less likely to injure intima

improvised.chest_tube: Cut to length, can fit larger vessels
improvised.Foley_catheter: With balloon cut off, can be used as shunt

technique.step_1: Obtain proximal and distal vascular control
technique.step_2: Debride vessel ends to healthy intima
technique.step_4: Cut shunt to appropriate length (1-2 cm excess)
technique.step_5: Insert distal end first, secure with 2-0 silk tie
technique.step_6: Insert proximal end, secure with 2-0 silk tie
technique.step_7: Release clamps, confirm flow with palpation/Doppler
technique.step_8: Cover with moist dressings, mark 'SHUNT' on patient

vessel_specific_considerations.iliac_vessels: Large bore chest tube may be needed
vessel_specific_considerations.venous_shunts: Possible but less common, ligation often tolerated

options: Ligation (generally well tolerated except IVC above renals)
Temporary shunt (if repair planned and resources available)

post_shunt_assessment: Doppler signal if pulse not palpable

outcomes.limb_salvage: 90%+ when followed by timely definitive repair

definition.@value: Temporary tubular conduit inserted to maintain arterial continuity and distal perfusion when definitive vascular repair cannot be immediately performed

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Identify indications for temporary vascular shunts in damage control
Describe commercial and improvised shunt options
Monitor shunt patency and plan for definitive repair
clinical_pearls: Shunts buy 24-48 hours - plan for definitive repair within this window
Insert distal end first - easier to advance and confirm position
Secure with heavy silk ties - vascular clamps may dislodge
Mark 'SHUNT' prominently on patient and in records
Most venous injuries can be ligated safely except IVC above renals
80-90% shunt patency at 24 hours without systemic anticoagulation

medicalCode.description: Thrombectomy of arterial or venous graft; with revision of arterial or venous graft
